title: list->bst
description: Write a function `list->bst` that takes a list of numbers and returns a binary search tree containing those numbers. The tree should be constructed by inserting elements in the order they appear in the list.

examples.explanation: Single element list produces single node tree
Elements inserted in order: 3, then 1 (left), then 4 (right), then 2 (right of 1)

hiddenCases: (check-expect (list->bst (list 5 3 7 1 4 6 8)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 4) 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5))
(check-expect (list->bst (list 1 2 3 4 5)) (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 2) empty 3) (make-node empty empty 4) 5))
(check-expect (list->bst (list 5 4 3 2 1)) (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 2) empty 3) empty 4) empty 5))

(check-expect (list->bst (list 8 4 12 2 6 10 14 1 3 5 7 9 11 13 15)) (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 2) (make-node empty empty 3) 4) (make-node (make-node empty empty 5) (make-node empty empty 7) 6) 8) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 9) (make-node empty empty 11) 10) (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) (make-node empty empty 15) 14) 12))

(check-expect (list->bst (list 10 5 15 3 7 12 17 1 4 6 8 11 13 16 18)) (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 4) 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 11) (make-node empty empty 13) 12) (make-node (make-node empty empty 16) (make-node empty empty 18) 17) 15) 10))
(check-expect (list->bst (list 4 2 6 1 3 5 7)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 5) (make-node empty empty 7) 6) 4))

(check-expect (list->bst (list 7 3 11 1 5 9 13 0 2 4 6 8 10 12 14)) (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 0) empty 1) (make-node empty empty 2) 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 4) (make-node empty empty 6) 5) 7) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 8) (make-node empty empty 10) 9) (make-node (make-node empty empty 12) (make-node empty empty 14) 13) 11))
